co.cask.cdap.api.workflow

Interface WorkflowToken


  • @Beta
public interface WorkflowToken
    Interface to represent the data that is transferred from one node to the next nodes in the Workflow.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  WorkflowToken.Scope
      Keys in the WorkflowToken can be added by user, using the put(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(String key,
       String value)
        Put the specified key and value into the WorkflowToken. The token may store additional information about the context in which this key is being set, for example, the unique name of the workflow node.
        Parameters:
        key - the key representing the entry
        value - the value for the key

      • put

        void put(String key,
       Value value)
        Put the specified key and Value into the WorkflowToken. The token may store additional information about the context in which this key is being set, for example, the unique name of the workflow node.
        Parameters:
        key - the key representing entry
        value - the Value for the key

      • get

        @Nullable
Value get(String key)
        Get the most recent value added for the specified key for a WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        Returns:
        the Value for the key or null if the key does not exist in the WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope

      • get

        @Nullable
Value get(String key,
                 WorkflowToken.Scope scope)
        Get the most recent value for the specified key for a given scope.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        scope - the WorkflowToken.Scope for the key
        Returns:
        the Value for the key from the specified scope or null if the key does not exist in the given scope

      • get

        @Nullable
Value get(String key,
                 String nodeName)
        Get the value set for the specified key by the specified node for a WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        nodeName - the name of the node
        Returns:
        the Value set for the key by nodeName or null if the key is not added by the nodeName in the WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope

      • get

        @Nullable
Value get(String key,
                 String nodeName,
                 WorkflowToken.Scope scope)
        Get the value set for the specified key by the specified node for a given scope.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        nodeName - the name of the node
        scope - the WorkflowToken.Scope for the key
        Returns:
        the Value set for the key by nodeName for a given scope or null if the key is not added by the nodeName in the given scope

      • getAll

        List<NodeValue> getAll(String key)
        Same key can be added to the WorkflowToken by multiple nodes. This method returns the List of NodeValue, where each entry represents the unique node name and the Value that it set for the specified key for a WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope.

        The list maintains the order in which the values were inserted in the WorkflowToken for a specific key except in the case of fork and join. In case of fork in the Workflow, copies of the WorkflowToken are made and passed along each branch. At the join, all copies of the WorkflowToken are merged together. While merging, the order in which the values were inserted for a specific key is guaranteed within the same branch, but not across different branches.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        Returns:
        the list of NodeValue from node name to the value that node added for the input key

      • getAll

        List<NodeValue> getAll(String key,
                     WorkflowToken.Scope scope)
        Same key can be added to the WorkflowToken by multiple nodes. This method returns the List of NodeValue, where each entry represents the unique node name and the Value that it set for the specified key for a given scope.

        The list maintains the order in which the values were inserted in the WorkflowToken for a specific key except in the case of fork and join. In case of fork in the Workflow, copies of the WorkflowToken are made and passed along each branch. At the join, all copies of the WorkflowToken are merged together. While merging, the order in which the values were inserted for a specific key is guaranteed within the same branch, but not across different branches.

        Parameters:
        key - the key to be searched
        scope - the WorkflowToken.Scope for the key
        Returns:
        the list of NodeValue from node name to the value that node added for the input key for a given scope

      • getAllFromNode

        Map<String,Value> getAllFromNode(String nodeName)
        Get the Map of key to Values that were added to the WorkflowToken by specific node for a WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the unique name of the node
        Returns:
        the map of key to values that were added by the specified node

      • getAllFromNode

        Map<String,Value> getAllFromNode(String nodeName,
                               WorkflowToken.Scope scope)
        Get the Map of key to Values that were added to the WorkflowToken by specific node for a given scope.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the unique name of the node
        scope - the WorkflowToken.Scope for the key
        Returns:
        the map of key to values that were added by the specified node for a given scope

      • getAll

        Map<String,List<NodeValue>> getAll()
        Same key can be added to the WorkflowToken by multiple nodes. This method returns the key to List of NodeValue added in the WorkflowToken.Scope.USER scope.
        Returns:
        the Map of key to List of NodeValue added for the given scope

      • getAll

        Map<String,List<NodeValue>> getAll(WorkflowToken.Scope scope)
        Same key can be added to the WorkflowToken by multiple nodes. This method returns the key to List of NodeValue added in the WorkflowToken.Scope provided.
        Parameters:
        scope - the scope for the key
        Returns:
        the Map of key to List of NodeValue added for the given scope

      • getMapReduceCounters

        @Deprecated
@Nullable
Map<String,Map<String,Long>> getMapReduceCounters()
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated as of release 3.1. Get the Hadoop counters from the previous MapReduce program in the Workflow. The method returns null if the counters are not set.
        Returns:
        the Hadoop MapReduce counters set by the previous MapReduce program
